intro: Urera lamiifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf urera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features heart-shaped, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pinkish-white flowers bloom in clusters and are accompanied by bracts that resemble leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
